heading.title:
Discover. Explore. Transform 
 Ibiapaba Tourism.
heading.description: Welcome to the Ibiapaba region's official tourism intelligence channel. Here you'll find data, maps, opportunities and connections that strengthen regional tourism.

form-card.title: Help improve the tourist experience
form-card.description:
Have you visited or are you visiting Ibiapaba? Share your experience!
Responding to our form takes less than 6 minutes and helps to develop a more sustainable, attractive and welcoming tourism.

bulletins-card.title: Read our informative bulletins
bulletins-card.description: See significant data on Ibiapaba collected by us and other sources, compiled and analyzed.

heading.title: Thank you very much for your contribution!
heading.description:
Your response has been successfully registered and is already helping to strengthen tourism in Ibiapaba.
üîç Every piece of data matters: your information will be part of the reports and analyses that guide actions by public authorities, private initiatives and the sustainable development of our region.

1.title: Data analysis:
1.description: Your form will be included in our database and will contribute to statistical and strategic studies.

2.title: Knowledge generation:
2.description: The information collected will feed the OTIB's quarterly bulletins and, soon, the interactive data portal, with dashboards open to the public.

3.title: Real improvements in the tourist experience:
3.description: Your opinions can inspire new routes, events, public policies, training and local investments.

heading.p:
The 
 Ibiapaba Tourism Observatory (üáßüá∑ Observat√≥rio de Turismo da Ibiapaba - OTIB) 
 was born with the purpose of transforming data into useful knowledge for the entire tourism chain, from entrepreneurs and public managers to educational institutions and the community itself. 
 The initiative is part of an extension project of the Federal Institute of Cear√° - Tiangu√° Campus, coordinated by Professor Dr. N√©cio de Lima Veras. The project is being developed by NUPREDS (Center for Practices in Engineering and Software Development), in partnership with SEBRAE, FORTIB (Ibiapaba Tourism Forum) and local representatives linked to tourism in the region.
 This portal will bring together interactive panels with tourist data from Ibiapaba, information materials and tools aimed at entrepreneurs, managers and other interested parties.

ul.li-1: Supporting public and private planning, offering information to help define public policies, investments, events and improvements in the services offered.
ul.li-2: Strengthening sustainable tourism, helping to balance tourism growth with the preservation of nature, local culture and the population's quality of life.
ul.li-3: Valuing attractions and the visitor experience, identifying what delights and what needs to be improved, from the point of view of those who visit the region.
ul.li-4: Stimulate innovation and competitiveness by offering strategic data that allows local businesses to align themselves with the demands of the tourism market.
ul.li-5: Encourage technological innovation projects, supporting the development of creative and sustainable solutions, based on data, that strengthen tourism and environmental preservation in Ibiapaba, such as applications, monitoring systems using computer vision, digital maps and intelligent management tools.
ul.li-6: To build a permanent channel for listening and participation, uniting academia, government, the productive sector and civil society in the construction of a more intelligent, collaborative tourism that is connected to the regional reality.

objectives.p: More than observing, the OTIB proposes to act based on evidence. By following the movements of tourism, we create opportunities to evolve together, with greater efficiency, inclusion and positive impact.
